oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Presidential memorial certificate
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Presidential memorial certificate awarded in memory of Hodge signed by President Gerald Ford.

After the Armistice was signed and the war officially over, Hodge stayed in France until 1919. He returned to Chattanooga, Tennessee, and built a career as a drug store and pharmacy owner. Hodge died June 4, 1975, at age 81. He is buried at Forest Hills Cemetery in Chattanooga, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Robert Frank Hodge World War I Papers, 1914-1919
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: American Field Service; World War, 1914-1918
Certificates
